title: Dataset
body:
The minimum size of the images in my dataset to train the network as it should be?
I have 100 images 24 x 24 pixels (obviously these are only for proof then I have a larger dataset but with many more images always of the same size) can they be fine or are larger images needed?

Epoch 00023: loss did not improve from 221.66633
Epoch 00023: early stopping
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "train.py", line 289, in <module>
    _main_(args)
  File "train.py", line 277, in _main_
    average_precisions = evaluate(infer_model, valid_generator)
  File "/Users/lucaalunni/Desktop/keras-yolo3/utils/utils.py", line 48, in evaluate
    pred_boxes = get_yolo_boxes(model, raw_image, net_h, net_w, generator.get_anchors(), obj_thresh, nms_thresh)[0]
  File "/Users/lucaalunni/Desktop/keras-yolo3/utils/utils.py", line 260, in get_yolo_boxes
    do_nms(boxes, nms_thresh)        
  File "/Users/lucaalunni/Desktop/keras-yolo3/utils/utils.py", line 166, in do_nms
    if bbox_iou(boxes[index_i], boxes[index_j]) >= nms_thresh:
  File "/Users/lucaalunni/Desktop/keras-yolo3/utils/bbox.py", line 57, in bbox_iou
    return float(intersect) / union
ZeroDivisionError: float division by zero
